intro: Justicia gonzalezii, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of white hair, giving them a fuzzy appearance. Justicia gonzalezii thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
